revision.text:
{{Wireless embedded system |brand=Netgear |model=R6000 |revision=v1 |series=AC750 |asin= |manuf_country=China |is_manuf=No |manuf=Delta Networks |manuf_model= |fcc_date=05/10/2013 |fcc_id=PY312400225 |ic_id=4054A-12400225 |pcb_id=2976443403 |type=wireless router |pwr_v=12 |pwr_amp=1.5 |pwr_conn=barrel |cpu1_brand=Atheros |cpu1_model=AR9344;AR9344-BC2A; |cpu1_cspeed=560 |fla1=128 |fla1_brand=Micron |fla1_model=MT29F1G08ABADA |ram1=128 |ram1_brand=Nanya |ram1_model=NT5TU32M16DG-AC |ram1_num=2 |wi1_chip1_brand=Atheros |wi1_chip1_model=AR9344;AR9344-BC2A; |wi1_802dot11_protocols=bgn |wi1_ant_conn=U.FL |wi1_txchains=2 |wi1_rxchains=2 |wi1_sstreams=2 |wi2_chip1_brand=Qualcomm Atheros |wi2_chip1_model=QCA9882;QCA9882-2R4E; |wi2_802dot11_protocols=an+ac |wi2_ant_conn=U.FL |wi2_txchains=1 |wi2_rxchains=1 |wi2_sstreams=1 |eth_cpu=true |sw_cpu=true |lan_speed=100M |lan_ports=4 |wan_speed=100M |wan_ports=1 |flags=DFS |802dot11_protocols=abgn+ac |default_ssid=NETGEARXX, NETGEARXX-5G |default_ssid_regex=^NETGEAR[0-9]{2}$,,, ^NETGEAR[0-9]{2}-5G$ |default_ip=192.168.1.1 |default_user=admin |default_pass=password |oui=44:94:FC |oui_eth=44:94:FC }}
:• '''433''' Mbps - 1SS 5GHz [https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/IEEE_802.11ac#Data_rates_and_speed 802.11ac] (80MHz chan.), :• '''300''' Mbps - 2SS 2.4GHz [https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/IEEE_802.11n-2009#Data_rates 802.11n] (40MHz chan.) = '''''AC750'' class'''
{{TagLine|R6000 WiFi Router}} :{{ProductPage|https://www.netgear.com/home/products/networking/wifi-routers/R6000.aspx}}{{SupportPage|vendor=Netgear|model=R6000}} "2976443403" is silkscreened on the board in the FCC photos. This FCC ID covers the R6000 and the R6100. Per the FCC test report... *The R6000 is 2x2 on the 2.4GHz band and 1x1 on the 5GHz band *The R6100 is 2x2 on the 2.4GHz band and 2x2 on the 5GHz band :The FCC operational description states ''the device'' uses AR9334 :(per the photos, AR9344-BC2A) and QCA9880 (QCA9882-2R4E). :Both devices are assumed to use the same ''[[QCA]]'' 5GHz radio. The default SSID patterns are presumed to be '''NETGEARXX''' and '''NETGEARXX-5G'''.
